description:
Of all the chromium forks out there Ungoogled is by far the most privacy and security sensitive, it does this without sacrificing usability, it is in most aspect a drop-in replacement of vanilla chromium.
This build includes all the codecs so you can just install it and use it like a chrome replacement too.

As a privacy nut and long time firefox user it's been hard to find something to replace it but ungoogled-chromium is the first browser that makes me feel just as safe if not safer than firefox

The browser is great if you don't need any modern aspect of a browser to be simple, like sync, setting browser as default, extensions, etc. It won't work as a daily driver for me but it has potential for other use cases.
It is so secure that it is not connected to the internet. In other words, it does not work.
Real men use ungoogled chromium

Of all the chromium forks out there Ungoogled is by far the most privacy and security sensitive, it does this without sacrificing usability, it is in most aspect a drop-in replacement of vanilla chromium.
This build includes all the codecs so you can just install it and use it like a chrome replacement too.

As a privacy nut and long time firefox user it's been hard to find something to replace it but ungoogled-chromium is the first browser that makes me feel just as safe if not safer than firefox

Make sure to install the "chromium-web-store" from github by NeverDecaf and you are golden to install any extension.
I can finally use Chrome without any google features! They were useless to me anyway, so this means I can use one of the best browsers without the things I don't need

description: Got away from Alphabet (Google and YouTube) and the others for a few reasons. I switched to Firefox, but it was clunky and Mozilla went the way of You-Twit-Face and Alphabet. Chromium imports everything (pass, links). Go to the get hub page and download/install "Chromium Web Store.crx" in developer mode, and then with some tweaking of "chrome://flags" and sets up to Rock. Worth it; LOVE IT!

# Setup Instructions
1. Turn on #extension-mime-request-handling
2. Install GH: NeverDecaf/chromium-web-store
3. Use the Chrome Web Store normally. Edge store does not work
4. Jump to settings to set the Omnibar search engine to Ecosia.

Alternatively, Use Chromium version.
Good alternative to Chromium
Use this app for a more private experience than what you'd get with Google Chrome/Chromium. It is stable, secure, and up to date.

Unstable connection with the internet, no easy way to install plugins. I use chrome/chromium when webpages aren't compatible with firefox, wanted a better experience. The standard flatpak version offers this.

Removes Dependency. This cuts the ties to Google, extentions, plugins, etc. (why you would use this) Much more private, without Google eyes watching everything. Extremely stable. If you want to use the extraneous extra "stuff" then just use Chrome, Opera, FireFox, etc.
Great privacy-friendly alternative to chromium/chrome. Use the flatpak version however - the rpm version was abandoned ~6 months ago

It even has extra features, like wiping the history when closing.

Only downside: Scrolling with the mouse is slower than in all other apps.
thank you for your amazing effort

The browser isn't bad. I like using Ungoogled Chromium as a fallback for my usual Firefox usage. It's pretty lean and it still supports Chrome extentions and themes, so the transition is nearly painless (with some small caveats, like having to manually install entensions/themes).

The reason I dropped a star is because the flatpak really should not be configured the way that it is. This is a web browser; software known for being exploited in order to steal user data. Why is it given access to my entire home directory out of the box? That's insane for a web browser. All configuration and cache files should be stored in the flatpak's virtual space, not the host filesystem. A web browser should have no need to have access to any other files or directories. Those features in flatpak exist for tools that are closely integrated with system components and NEED it... not something that merely views remote HTML files. If a download is needed to be performed, you should be using flatpak's portal API to temporarily "poke a hole" in the sandbox. There should be absolutely no need to give any web browser full home access and it really should be seen as a security issue. It's not that I don't trust the developers/maintainers of Ungoogled Chromium, I just don't trust the entire internet with relative easy access to my entire home directory.

As a user, a stopgap fix in the meantime is to use Flatseal to revoke the "All user files" permissions and set a custom directory under "Other files" to a dedicated downloads folder (where you won't store any sensitive personal information). Just be aware of the limitations you are placing on yourself for the sake of security. Ideally, this app should just be updated to actually utilize flatpak portals instead of essentially dropping the sandbox entirely for user data, so we won't have to put up with the issues that come along with forcing an app to be sandboxed when it isn't designed for that (yet).
summary: Great browser, less than secure flatpak

description: Corriendo bien en Ubuntu Unity 20.04
perfecto, muy recomendable

UngoogledChromium c'est Chromium SANS Google.
Par exemple, pour installer des modules (extensions) comme Ublock Origin ou Privacy Badger vous devez :

1- go on this website
https://crxextractor.com/

2-
Click on "Start for free"

3-
copy and paste the url of the chrome extension (here Ublock Origin)

https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/ublock-origin/cjpalhdlnbpafiamejdnhcphjbkeiagm

4- Click on "Download" and after that on Get .CRX

5- a small window is opened on the right: click ACCEPT or ADD the extension and it is fine.
Chromium est la version libre et opensource de Google Chrome. C'est mon navigateur préféré depuis un certain temps déjà.

1) Suivre les instructions sur https://github.com/NeverDecaf/chromium-web-store

2) Installez vos extensions depuis https://chrome.google.com/webstore/category/extensions
summary: Nécessite une manip pour installer des extensions
